It's not worth it to make a huge change to solve the dev fund issue, imo. Focus on usage and everything else will follow.

Content: [dscrd-hush] <scubapanda> I suggest (Duke?) coding  the sapling upgrade and including a 10% dev fee (lets vote) for the next five years. Hush has little future if the is no development & bug fixing and that typically doesn't happen without a reward.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Cye_BigDaddy> All the projects need to have some kind of dev fee if you ask me.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Eddy O> Duke has already said many times it's a passion project. He is doing the current n necessary work (thank you, Duke) regardless of lack of funds. Can he do all in future? No, but devs can build something on top of hush (like a program utilizing hushlist) and get fees that way. If you implement large additional fees on base layer, it's a bad idea. A small increase in transaction fees for all miners is a better idea (hope that trickles down to devs and hope the devs are mining).

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Eddy O> Duke is also a KMD notary, so hopefully that helps him have the ability to do the core issues on hush when he has time.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Eddy O> Basically, hush won't be dead for awhile. Focus on usage and all should be ok.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <finrecon> But first there needs to be an actual product with a use case which you can market.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> I originally paused working on HushList because it's too slow on Sprout. Sapling makes a simple operation "send a hello message to Alice" take a few seconds, when it takes 45 minutes on Sprout. Real-time-ish communication is not possible with Sprout. When Hush upgrades to Sapling, all HushList operations get a crazy amount faster, and many things become possible. A native desktop app that allows the doing some very basic things described in the whitepaper seems to be the "actual product"

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> additionally, Sprout has a bug which allows very smart people to print infinite amounts of shielded Sprout funds

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> so Sapling is both an upgrade and a bugfix. There is no intermediate option, sprout is fundamentally broken in a very very subtle way

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrd-hush] <ITM> graviex and crex24 is the safest bet.
Having graviex, crex24 and tradesatoshi will be good since volume at crex24 is decent enough.
Second target will be 2 good exchanges(getting cryptopia up and lastly getting a exchange with decent volume)
lastly is to target bittrex and kraken

Hush got a lot of work needs to be done
- Critical the zcash vulnerability.(I sold out 75% hush until this is fix)
- Explorer
- Sapling
- A lot of upgrades and optimization required

There no road map since no dedicated dev, this is critical
1. Hush need to rebase with zcash code base to fix a lot of vulnerabilities and sapling upgrade. 
2 Hush need to introduce a 10% fee in mining block.
2. Hush needs 2 stable explorer.
3. Hush need to have 3 stable exchanges.
4. Notary needs integration with wallet.
5. Hush need more hush rate(5 Mhash+).

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <gilardh> @ITM Can you be more precise when you say: 'A lot of upgrades and optimization required' ?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrd-hush] <ITM> @gilardh 
1. Wallet using java, the version is outdated. Second is java is no longer free. The other javascript wallet does not do justice. Badly coded, lot of issues.
2. Database scan times are increasing, optimizations needs to be done. We never implement anything since v1. 
3. The original road map where hush suppose to be secure messaging blockchain. Hush Messenger and HushList  needs working on.
4. SSL need certs need to be renewed
The list is huge lol

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> I agree with the monero folks, that zcash saying everything is "remediated" and users need to take "no action" is not quite right. They are obviously downplaying the seriousness of this, and they are bored of keeping it secret for 11 months
